item.title: Financial management
item.description: An online communication agency of Macau reported that a cybernaut was circulating (whom we will call John) where he said he had a monthly income of 30,000 patacas, but that he was with financial embarrassment because he was single, had bought a house and paid the installments to the bank, had monthly expenses, had no savings and asked how to do to improve his situation. Many cybernauts responded to this publication, asking the reason for the high expenses, if they were due to careless spending, if they had bad habits, etc. Many of them highlighted that a way to manage money is to “increase income”. John could look for part-time work or change jobs to make more money. Others suggested that if he lives alone and has a free room could rent him. If I rent the room, John may also consider cooking socks with the tenant to reduce food expenses. Another important principle of financial management is the creation of “savings”, which implies “reducing expenses to the very least”. Therefore, the cybernauts asked John how much he paid to the bank for the provision of the house and if there would be the possibility of renegotiating it. Others suggested that they shop in mainland China to reduce expenses. Keeping expenses but increasing revenues, John may have a financial surplus, which can apply to daily spending and savings. On the other hand, with the same income and reduced expenses, it can obtain the same result and achieve your desire to save money. Which of the two options is better? If you reduce expenses but keep the same income, you will only be able to save a little. If you increase income, you will have several sources of revenue and future financial growth will be higher, and you can still create savings to ensure “times of need”. How much do you need to spare to collect “times of need”? Two million? Three million? We will discuss this issue next week. To achieve prudent financial management, beyond the above advice, John has to consider two questions. First, what is the objective of financial management? Second, what is the financial management model? The purpose of the financial management of most people is to make them richer. If you are richer means you have more money to spend in the future, then you will have to have expenditure on expenses. To achieve this goal, John must set different temporal goals. For example, increase the performance between 5% and 25% within a year, changing jobs or getting more part-time work, then having your own business within five years, etc. After getting his goal, John can give himself a gift, such as a two -month trip to Europe, buy a good car, etc. Of course, both traveling and shopping are ways of getting satisfaction through consumption. John can only be truly happy when he reaches his goals. If it only spends money impensely, it will have a brief happiness and will be on its way to the financial disaster and may pay a very high price, so it must be very careful. Another purpose of financial management is to increase savings to have more resources in the future, increasing their quality of life. For example, having more money to pay the house at full earlier and get a state of “financial semi-freedom”; This method is better than spending in a thoughtless way. After setting these objectives, the next step is to consider the model to use to measure your financial performance. The average monthly yield in Macao is about 20,000 patacas. John currently earns 30,000, exceeding the average salary. John owns a house. With a monthly yield of 30,000 patacas, your financial level is very good. After establishing the model and the financial objectives, there are two points to note. First, the publication did not mention whether or not John was in love. If you want to get married, your home will be subject to the Macao Family Law and the property can be changed. John must think carefully in the way of dealing with this issue. Secondly, the value of the house is high, but if liquidity is low, the performance may vary depending on market fluctuations. The real estate market is currently slow. If most capital is invested in the house and suddenly it is necessary to have available a high amount, there will be a financial problem and John has to be more careful. Increasing income and reducing expenses, living within our possibilities, and increasing savings are the basic principles of personal financial management; But we must also have objectives and clarify our financial growth. We can only guarantee that our financial situation is consistent with our socio-economic framework, and that we are not demanding more or less of ourselves when we adopt the correct financial standards. We must also make the appropriate adjustments to our financial goals based on our own circumstances, ensure that we have enough money to cover daily expenses and have plans to precipate future changes, so that we can enjoy the happiness that money gives us. David Chan Legal Consultant of the Association for the Promotion of Jazz in Macau Associate Professor at the Faculty of Management Sciences, Macau Polytechnic University Email: cbchan@mpu.edu.mo

item.title: Casinos | Ernst & Young accused of ignoring crimes in Macau
item.description:
Consultant Ernst & Young has been accused by an old employee of having ignored Junket Suncity and Tak Chun in Macau for years for years. The employee filed a complaint against the company in the US after, in his words, he made several alerts about the situation
Admittedly, the former bosses of the Junket Sunning (Alvin Chau) and Tak Chun (Levo Chan) groups are already fulfilled the penalties to which they were convicted, but organized crime cases associated with the two companies that operated in the Macao game sector, raising VIP customers, still raise controversy. This time, an former employee of consultant Ernst & Young (EY), Joe Howie, who put the company in court accusing it of ignoring the warning signs that something was not well in these Junket companies or in associated companies. Joe Howie, who co-led EY's global excellence center, says that for years he has warned of adherence to standards defined by Public Company Accounting Oversight Board, resisting investigations or denying suspending contracts with clients being investigated. According to Agbrief portal, Howie worked 35 years at EY and, under the “Sarbanes-Oxley Act” legislation, has now complained in a US Federal Court, claiming that the company retaliated against it for alerting the operations of SUNCITY and CHUN TAK. According to the complaint, violations of the US securities and anti -tic conduct laws are concerned. In the judicial action it is indicated that EY has done for years consulting work and has audited accounts of the two Junket companies also in other Asian markets. The employee says Ey knew he was working with companies linked to the Suncity group, including US people who had major operations in Macao casinos. EY will not have noticed the absence of data provided by these companies to the consultant. "Despite repeated warnings, EY continued to profit from contracts signed with these high-risk clients," reads the process. Joe Howie was “marginalized and forced to reform in advance, being expelled from society as a form of retaliation,” is referred to. The Three Families In the complaint starring Joe Howie, it is also read that five companies listed in the US, and with connections near the local game sector, were associated with “families linked to the Chinese triads, including Stanley Ho descendants”, and the complaint “identifies three families, but by the association and papers they had in companies, allegedly linked to Alvin Chau Empire Junket and Other contact networks, ”reads the news. item.title: Game | GrandView Casino-Satellite will close doors tomorrow
item.description:
GrandView is the first casino-satellite to end since the legal reform that dictated the end of these spaces. According to the SJM concessionaire and DICJ, at least seven residents may be unemployed, while the number of non-resorted workers was not revealed
Although satellites are allowed to operate by the end of the year, the GrandView Casino in Taipa will end the doors tomorrow. The announcement was made yesterday by the concessionaire SJM Resorts, through a statement, and directly affects 166 workers. According to the Directorate of Inspection and Coordination of Games (DICJ), seven of these resident workers will be dismissed. Satellite casinos result from agreements between some independent dealers and companies, which exploit various game spaces. According to the latest changes proposed by the government and approved by the Legislative Assembly, satellite casinos have to be closed by the end of the year. The alternative is now explored by the dealers, a situation that will only be seen with the L'ARC and Ponte 16 casinos. "Following the general planning of the company and commercial considerations, the GrandView Casino will officially cease operations earlier than expected, at 11:59 pm on Wednesday, July 30, 2025," was justified. “All game tables currently operating on site will be redistributed to other company casinos to continue to serve our estimated customers,” he was added. The company also communicated customers with cards, deposits or cash discounts accumulated at the GrandView casino that if they are not reimbursed after closing they can go to the Casa Real casino to deal with the situation. "The company will ensure that all customer rights will be properly honored," he was nominated. Assured jobs In the statement issued yesterday morning, the company assured that “all local workers”, hired by SJM, who worked at the GrandView Casino will be transferred to other casinos “according to operational needs”. The potential vacancy of dismissal will only affect non-resident workers, although the number has not been disclosed. The concessionaire also reported that the seven employees of the company that explores the casino and that they will be unemployed can apply for jobs and will have "priority in hiring equal circumstances." "The company is still committed to fulfill its business responsibilities and contribute to the stable development of the Macao game sector in partnership with the local community," he was bound. Dicj accompanies closure Minutes after the SJM statement, also the Game Inspection and Coordination Directorate (DICJ) took a position on a much discussed subject in society and far from consensus, mainly due to the impact on indirect jobs, ie business -generated by restaurants, pledge or hotels that survive due to customers of these casinos. "As for casino-satellite workers, the DICJ will maintain close communication with the direction of services to labor affairs (DSAL), in order to ensure strict compliance with the commitments made by the SJM, namely the proposal previously presented, as regards the remuneration, the perks and working conditions of its 159 workers highlighted in the referred casino satellite," he was informed. "And at the same time, providing opportunities to change employment to the 7 workers recruited by the casino-satellite itself, in order to ensure their employment continuity," he was stressed. In the statement, the government indicates that the SJM decision resulted from commercial logic, despite admitting that the law was amended and that the satellite casinos become illegal next year. DICJ also reported that it will send workers to the scene to ensure the "proper treatment of cash and play cards stored in the treasury, unused cash coupons and the exchange of the play cards."

item.title: Judicial Police | Child falls from window when he was alone
item.description:
Authorities indicted the mother and maid of the crime of abandonment, punishable by prison sentence that could reach eight years. The child was alone at home, while the maid went to pick up his brother from school
The Judicial Police (PJ) indicated the mother and maid of the crime of abandonment, after a child fell from a window when he was alone at home. The case took place on July 15, but the information about the investigation was revealed on Friday by PJ, according to the newspaper or Mun. The case was discovered around 1 pm, when the boy was found on the floor of Gamboa Street, after falling from a four -story building. The victim of the fall was taken to the hospital, where he was diagnosed with an intra-cranial hemorrhage, being hospitalized. Until yesterday, the authorities did not reveal whether the male child was at risk of life. Given the possibility of having a crime, the PJ agents investigated the fall and found that on the morning of the accident both the parents and the child's brother had left home. The child stood to keep a maid, who was also responsible for fetching the victim's older brother from school. When she fetched her brother, the maid left the boy alone at home with a tablet and locked the housing door. The minor's mother was informed about the conditions in which the child had been left. However, the PJ says it concluded that when the child was alone at home began to cry and scared. The victim also tried to use tools to open the door. However, as it could not open the door, the authorities believe that the child tried to get out of housing through the kitchen window, which led to the fall. Authorities also found that this was not the first time the boy has been home alone, which would have happened more often since June 17. The child's injuries were considered consistent with a fall in height. The case was delivered to the prosecutor and the mother and worker are indicted for the crime of abandonment, punished with a sentence of one to five years in prison, which in this case may be aggravated to eight years in prison, if it is considered that the injuries are serious offense to physical integrity. Accompanying After the investigation was made public, Hon Wai, president of the Institute of Social Action, said the family is being accompanied and that is "deeply sad", according to the Macao channel of TDM. "Unfortunately, I believe everyone knows this unfortunate incident. The family is deeply sad and IAS is providing direct assistance to the family," he said. "We need to work hard with this family, how to deal with the future and the care of children," he acknowledged. According to the or world, the president of IAS also called on families to avoid leaving children alone at home, even if it is for a short time, because there are always "risks" in these situations. Hon Wai thus asked families to try better coordination to accompany children and involve more members in the surveillance of minors.

item.title: Shaolin Temple | Religious Statute withdrawn for embezzlement
item.description: Chinese authorities yesterday revoked Shi Yongxin's religious status, abbot of the famous Shaolin temple, which is being investigated by alleged financial crimes and maintaining improper relationships in violation of Buddhist precepts. The China Buddhist Association, subordinate to the Chinese Communist Party's United Front Department, announced that he had withdrawn the certificate of monastic ordination to the religious after receiving a request from the Provincial Association of Henan. 59 -year -old Shi Yongxin is suspected of having diverted funds linked to temple projects and usurping the monastery's assets, and for years maintaining relations with several women, of which he will have had at least one child, according to religious authorities. Located in the central province of Henan, the Shaolin Temple is one of the best known in China and the international symbol of Chan Buddhism and Kung-Fu, subjects that have given it worldwide fame and turned it into an important tourist destination. Known by the secular name Liu Yincheng, Shi Yongxin had led the temple three decades ago. Built over 1,500 years ago, in Dengfeng, the monastery is considered the cradle of Zen Buddhism and Shaolin martial arts. By 2015, the monk had already been the target of similar accusations made by former monks and temple officials, but authorities then closed the case without charges. The scandal has not affected, for now, the tourist activity of the monastery, which remains open to the public, confirmed the temple visitor center to the local newspaper The Paper.

item.title: Thailand/Cambodia | “IMMEDIATE AND UNCONDITIONAL” cease accepted by both parties
item.description:
Thailand and Cambodia agreed with the ceasefire proposed yesterday at a meeting in Malaysia after the worst fighting of the last decade. Hours before the negotiations began, representatives from both countries exchanged accusations
Thailand and Cambodia agreed with a “immediate and unconditional ceasefire, the Prime Minister of Malaysia announced yesterday after performing peace negotiations. Anwar Ibrahim, who received leaders from both countries, said the ceasefire will start at midnight on Monday, local time. "Both Cambodia and Thailand have reached a common understanding," said Ibrahim after mediation negotiations in Malaysia. The ambassadors of the United States and China in Malaysia were also present at the meeting in the administrative capital of Malaysia, Putrajaya. Malaysia holds the rotating presidency of the Southeast Asia Nations Association (Asean), of which Bangkok and Phnom Penh are members, and already intervened as a mediator between the parts on the second day of the difference. At least 35 people were killed and more than 270,000 displaced by the worst fighting in more than a decade among neighboring countries. The clashes continued in the early hours of Monday, a few hours before the negotiations began. In addition to the physical confrontation, the leaders of both countries also exchanged accusations hours before negotiations that seem to point to the end of the conflict. The Thai Acting Prime Minister accused Cambodia of lack of "good faith" by leaving for Malaysia. "We don't think Cambodia is acting in good faith, taking into account the actions to solve the problem. They have to show a sincere intention," Phumtham Wechayachai told journalists at the Bangkok airport. Cambodia also stated that the attacks continued in the early hours of Monday in the temples of Ta Moan Thom and Ta Kraby, over 400 kilometers of Bangkok and Phnom Penh. Cambodian Ministry of Defense spokesman Mlay Socheata said at a press conference that Thailand attacked Cambodian territory between Sunday and yesterday dawn with artillery obuses and fragmentation pumps. “We underline the need for both parties to exercise the maximum containment and commit to immediate ceasefire, refraining from any action that may harm it,” reads a statement from the Malaysian Ministry of Foreign Affairs even before the meeting. "We have exhorted both parties to cease all hostilities, to return to the negotiation table to restore peace and stability, and to solve different ways and divergences by peaceful means," said the government of Kuala Lumpur. Attentive powers United States Diplomacy Chief Marco Rubio urged the two countries to decrease the tensions “immediately” and to agree with a ceasefire in the border dispute. "Both the president [Donald] Trump and I are in contact with our counterparts from each country and we are following the situation very close. We want this conflict to finish as soon as possible," Rubio pointed out on the social network X. Also the Chinese Foreign Ministry has appealed to peace. "Cambodia and Thailand are nearby neighbors and friends from China. Peace and the good neighborhood are of the common interest of both parties," said Ministry spokesman Guo Jiakun at a press conference. The statements come after the Thai interim prime minister, Phumtham Wechayachai, quoted China, along with the United States and Malaysia, as one of the countries that "intervened to help" the meeting between Bangcoque and Phnom Penh, in confrontation since last Thursday due to a territorial dispute on the ordinary border. In addition to Washington, Beijing and Asean, also the UN, European Union, Japan and Russia, among others, appealed to containment and dialogue between the parties.

item.title: Tariffs | China and the United States gathered to extend truce
item.description: American and Chinese guardians have been gathered since yesterday in Stockholm, with the aim of prolonging the truce in the trade war between the two largest economies in the world, in an uncertain context. This is the third meeting between Beijing and Washington, after meetings in Geneva, in May, and London, in June, which allowed to end the commercial tensions between the two countries. The meeting takes place at the beginning of a decisive week for US President Donald Trump's commercial policy, as tariffs applied to most of the top US business partners are expected to be a strong increase from Friday. Stockholm discussions aim to prolong the 90-day break in May in Geneva, which ended reprisals on both sides of the Pacific, responsible for 125 percent overcrowders on US products and 145 percent over Chinese products.

item.title: China | Analysis: Battle against deflation and excess supply still away from victory
item.description:
Financial Times warned that China remains far from overcoming deflation, although homologous inflation returned to positive land in June for the first time since January. Analysts advised a reduction in supply
According to the Financial Times (FT) editorial, published on Sunday, “few believe that sustained prices growth is back,” due to the weak internal demand. Beijing has made efforts to encourage consumption, but will have to go further, namely by strengthening social pension systems and benefits, to reduce families' preventive savings. The FT also underlines that the deflationary dynamics will not be fought if the Chinese Communist Party does not face the excess of offer. Deflation consists of a drop in prices over time, as opposed to a climb (inflation). The phenomenon reflects weakness in domestic consumption and investment and is particularly dangerous, as a drop in the price of assets, as a rule of credit, generates an imbalance between the value of loans and bank guarantees. Another effect is to lead to the postponement of consumer and investment decisions as a result of lower pricing expectations in the future, and can create a price -descendant spiral and look hard to reverse, affecting the entire economy. The risk of deflation in the Chinese economy has worsened in the last two years, raised by a profound real estate crisis, which has affected investment and consumption, and excessive production capacity in various sectors. Production prices have been falling since October 2022, in a context where Chinese factories reduce prices to maintain market share, both in traditional industries, steel and cement, and in modern sectors, including electric vehicles, solar panels and artificial intelligence. The British newspaper recalls that Chinese President Xi Jinping, and other responsible responsible has denying external concerns about excessive production capacity to criticize domestic manufacturers by the Neijuan phenomenon, an expression used to describe excessive competition in prices. Efficiency The editorial emphasizes that Beijing's own policies have feed the problem, with the bet on “new quality productive forces”, aimed at advanced technologies and new industries, triggering a race to attract political support and local subsidies. The result is “an investment outbreak with excessive duplications”, leading to price cuts and stored products, from electrical vehicles parked in ports to semiconductors to unused artificial intelligence systems. "It is becoming increasingly difficult for Chinese manufacturers to export this over production as business partners are more aware of the impact of importing cheap products on their local industries," says the newspaper. Several of the major business partners in the Asian country, including European Union, United States, but also developing countries such as Brazil, have adopted protectionist measures, including increased customs rates, and launched anti -dumping investigations against China. Dumping consists of sale below production cost. Financial Times argues that Beijing should limit “generosity of the state” and create a more unified national market, restricting distortion incentives from local governments. It also proposes to change the provincial goals, reducing the emphasis on gross domestic product, and reinforcing the protection of intellectual property to encourage more innovative differentiation. According to the editorial, Xi Jinping may try to set production ceilings and press manufacturers to reduce the offer, but "Beijing will do well to realize that their excessive support is the problem." “The state can build factories, but cannot manufacture efficiency,” says Financial Times.

item.title: Diplomacy | Thailand agrees in principle with ceasefire with Cambodia
item.description:
Thailand's interim prime minister Phumtham Wechayachai said yesterday that the country agreed, in principle, with a ceasefire, but emphasized the need for “sincere intentions” by Cambodia
According to Thai Foreign Ministry, Phumtham WeChayachai called on rapid bilateral negotiations to discuss concrete measures towards a peaceful conflict resolution. The current government leader also thanked the president of the United States, with whom he spoke hours earlier, in a telephone conversation where Donald Trump presented a ceasefire proposal. Also Cambodian Prime Minister Hun Manet said yesterday that the country accepted negotiations for an "immediate and unconditional ceasefire." "This is good news for soldiers and people from both countries," said Cambodian leader in a statement. Manet instructed Foreign Minister Prak Sokhonn to start discussions with US counterpart Marco Rubio to end the conflict that broke out on Thursday. Still, journalists from the France-Presse news agency in Samraong, Cambodia, about 20 kilometers from the Thailand border, heard the sound of artillery shots at dawn. A spokeswoman for the Cambodia Ministry of Defense also stated that Thailand had attacked at 4:50 am (05h50 in Macao) near two temples whose sovereignty is disputed by the two countries. Colonel Richa Suksowanont, the Thai army deputy spokesman, accused Cambodian forces of shooting yesterday morning heavy artillery against Surin's province, including civilian houses. Richa Suksowanont said Cambodia also launched rocket attacks against the former Ta Muen Thom temple, claimed by both countries, and other areas, in an attempt to recover the protected territory by Thai troops. The Thai forces responded with long-range artillery to reach the artillery and the Cambojan launches. Battlefield operations will continue and a ceasefire can only happen if Cambodia formally starts negotiations, Richa Suksowanont added. On the other side Cambodian Ministry of Defense spokesman, Lieutenant General Maly Socheata, accused Thai forces of intensifying violence with bombing in Cambodian territory on Sunday morning, followed by a “large-scale foray” involving land tanks and troops in various areas. "Such actions undermine all efforts to a peaceful resolution and expose Thailand's clear intention to intensify the conflict rather than appease it," he said. A historic border dispute between the two countries led on Thursday to clashes that involved fighters, tanks, land troops and artillery. The fighting caused 33 deaths and more than 130,000 displaced on both sides of the border. The balance already exceeds the previous series of major border clashes between the two countries, which caused 28 deaths between 2008 and 2011. The UN Security Council met in urgent and, on Saturday, the United Nations Secretary-General António Guterres, condemned the escalation of violence between Thailand and Cambodia, asked both parties who commit to a ceasefire and offered as a mediator.

item.title: Telegram | Thousands of men shared intimate photos of women
item.description: Thousands of men in China shared pictures and intimate videos of their girlfriends or wives, without their consent, in applying Telegram messages, which generated a general appeal to reinforce women's protection. The wave of reactions occurred after a Chinese student was expelled from a university in mid-July for “violation of national dignity” after an e-sport's Ukrainian player released videos on Telegram, showing that they had intimate relationships. A similar event took place on Thursday. A Chinese discovered that photos of her, taken without her knowledge, were shared in a forum of this same messaging with over 100,000 users, especially Chinese men, revealed Southern Daily, a state of state communication. “We are not content that can be discharged, viewed and randomly fantasized,” one can read in a comment on the Red Note social network. “We can no longer remain silent.” Because next time, I can be me, or be you, ”he adds. Pornography is illegal in China and conservative behaviors in relation to women remain the norm, reinforced by state media and popular culture. The largest group of this type on Telegram, called “Mask Park”, has been removed since, but smaller groups derived from this remain active, according to the woman contacted by Southern Daily. Other forum members also shared photos of their current or old companions, according to an article published in the Guangming Daily, a medium of communist communisting Chinese in power, raising a general shock on the Internet. A hashtag associated with this case has been consulted more than 230 million times on the Weibo social platform since Thursday. Chinese authorities have not yet announced any measures against Telegram, which is forbidden in China, but is still accessible through some virtual private networks, the platform told AFP news agency.

item.title: Technology | Beijing wants to reconcile artificial intelligence and its risks
item.description:
The Chinese government has called for reconciliation between the development of artificial intelligence and the risks posed by this technology, defending global consensus, despite the rivalry between Beijing and Washington on this issue
US President Donald Trump released this week an action plan to promote unrestricted development of American Artificial Intelligence (AI) models in the United States and abroad, discarding concerns about potential abuse. The US president thus breaks with the line of democratic predecessor Joe Biden, who defended controlled development. “We won't let any other nation won us” in the AI race, Trump said. On Saturday, at the opening of the World Artificial Intelligence Conference (Waic) in Shanghai, Chinese Prime Minister Li Qiang appealed to good governance and resource sharing, namely the creation of an organism, launched by China, to stimulate international AI cooperation. "The risks and challenges associated with artificial intelligence are attracting wide attention ... Finding a balance between development and safety requires urgent and broader consensus of the whole of society," he said. It did not provide details about the new body, although state media reported that “the first consideration” was that the headquarters was in Shanghai (Northeast). The organization should “promote global governance, broad consultation, joint contribution and shared benefits,” said Chinese state news agency Xinhua. A Baby Tiger At a time when AI is being part of virtually all sectors, use has raised significant ethical issues ranging from disinformation to impact on employment and potential loss of technological control, France-Presse news agency said. During a speech at the Shanghai Conference, the Nobel Prize for Physics, Geoffrey Hinton, used a metaphor, 'as a baby tiger to live at home' to describe the current global situation. Hinton described the current attitude towards AI as similar to "a person adopting a cute tiger puppy as a pet." "To survive," he said, "one must be sure that one can train him so that he doesn't kill him when he grows up." The huge advances in AI technology in recent years have also placed her at the forefront of rivalry between the United States and China. China “actively encourages” the development of open source AI and is willing to share technological advances with other countries, especially developing nations, he said. "If we establish technological monopolies, controls or barriers, artificial intelligence risks becoming a privilege of a small number of countries and companies," he warned, in turn, Li Qiang. Foreign Minister Ma Zhaoxu warned, in turn, against "unilateralism and protectionism" at a subsequent meeting. The United States has intensified efforts in recent years to restrict advanced chip exports to China, with Washington to manifest concern that they can be used to modernize Chinese military and weaken the US position in technology race. The Chinese prime minister cited “the scarcity of chips and computational capacity” between a list of obstacles to the development of the sector.

item.title: North Korea | Kim calls for preparation “for war seriously”
item.description: The North Korean leader asked the country's soldiers to prepare "for a serious war," during a witnessing scout he witnessed, the Official North Korean press said yesterday. Photos released by KCNA news agency show Kim Jong-un, dressed in a black fact, heading to uniform soldiers. Other images show Kim to carefully observe an artillery shooting exercise alongside several North Korean military leaders. The shooting session took place on Wednesday, in an unveiled place. Images released by the agency also showed projectiles to be fired towards the sea. During the visit, Kim spoke to the North Korean soldiers, whom they asked to prepare “for a serious war” and to be able to “destroy the enemy in all battles,” according to KCNA. This visit happens after a North Korean contingent participated in combat against the Ukrainian forces in the Russian region of Kursk, partially occupied by Kiev troops since the summer of 2024 and that Russia announced that it had fully resumed in late April.

item.title: Thailand | Nine dead and 14 injured by Cambojan air strikes
item.description:
Cambojan air strikes killed nine people, including an eight -year -old, and wounded 14, the Thai army said yesterday, the day the conflict between the two countries intensified
Nine people died and 14 were injured in Thailand following the Cambodian air strike offensive. According to the Thai army, one of the deadly victims was a 14 -year -old child. Thailand said it had launched air strikes against two military targets in Cambodia, while Cambodian soldiers fired several rockets against Thai territory. Six people were killed in attacks near a fuel supply post in Sisaket (Northeast), two in the province of Surin (Northeast) and one in the province of Ubon Ratchathani (Northeast). Thai authorities announced the full closure of all terrestrial border passages with Cambodia, after clashes between the two armies in various areas that separate these neighboring countries. The level of security in the border passages was high for the 4-the maximum-which constitutes a complete closure, said at a press conference the spokesman for the Thai center that monitors the situation on the border with Cambodia, Admiral Surasant KongSiri. "Given the current situation, it is necessary for Thailand to close the barriers on border passages to protect our sovereignty, territorial integrity and the safety of people in border zones," said the center of the Center, Maratee Nalita at the same time. Coveted land Since late June, Thailand has implemented access restrictions on all border posts over the more than 800 kilometers of border that shares with Cambodia, allowing entry only for humanitarian reasons, health or education. The total closure comes after yesterday's clashes between Thai and Cambodian armies in a border zone disputed, according to both sides, who mutually accuse themselves to start the conflict after weeks of tension. However, Cambodia Prime Minister Hun Manet yesterday requested an emergency meeting of the UN Security Council. "Considering the recent extremely serious aggressions of Thailand, which have severely threatened peace and stability in the region, I sincerely ask you to call an emergency meeting of the Security Council to end Thailand's aggression," Hun Manet wrote in a letter to the President of Security Council, Asim Iftikhar Ahmad. The longstanding conflict between the two countries rekindled on May 28, after a confrontation between the two armies around an unrestricted border zone claimed by the two nations, which resulted in the death of a Cambodian soldier. The Thailand Embassy in Cambodia yesterday asked Thai citizens to abandon the neighboring country, after the confrontations and given the possibility of the attacks "continuing and spreading." Territorial tension has been usually approached diplomatically, although between 2008 and 2011, about 30 people died in military clashes between the two countries in a territory adjacent to the Hindu Temple of Preah Vihear.

item.title: Anabela Santiago, Academic: “China is a reformist and moderate”
item.description:
Anabela Santiago has just defended at the University of Aveiro the doctoral thesis that analyzes how China has been positioned in recent decades as an important actor in the “global health governance”. Today, Beijing seeks “alternative mechanisms” of cooperation in the “global south” and tries to build an alternative model to the World Health Organization
Let's start with the concept of Global Health Governance (GGS). Is this a more contemporary concept or relating to the post-war period and the Foundation of the World Health Organization (WHO)? What have been the main actors of this governance until China's growth? GGS is a concept whose prominence and relevance have grown significantly in the 21st century, largely driven by economic globalization and worldwide interconnection. Although global health has always transcended national borders, demanding multidisciplinary approaches and international cooperation, only from the 1990s it was made greater awareness of it. Historically, GGS has been predominantly influenced by western powers and neoliberal values. The main actors of this governance, until China's growth, were historically marked by interventions of entities such as WHO and non-governmental, predominantly American and European organizations. One of the findings of its doctoral thesis is that China has been progressively positioning itself in this leadership. This position started specifically when and why? Yes, China has been progressively positioned as a relief actor in the evolution of the GG system. Although it is not possible to point out an exact date of start, China has evolved from a relatively isolated country to a main actor in global political, economic and technological arenas. Its growing economic and political influence also represents a change in GGS's historical dynamics, and in the 1960s China tried to play a humanitarian health care role in neighboring countries and Africa. The thesis points out that China's experience can be seen as an example of what is achievable when a state chooses its own way rather than a pre-established model, aligning itself with the 21st century prediction as the "century of Asia." Did the pandemic years influence this position? How? Covid-19 pandemic highlighted the need for global health cooperation, as well as the potential consequences of the failure to prioritize global health. The thesis explores the evolution of the Health Silk Route before and after the pandemic, indicating that the pandemic years allowed greater awareness of the need for instruments such as the Health Silk Route as the most effective cooperation platforms among nations. Although not detailed in this specific section, it is implicit that the pandemic intensified China's performance in health diplomacy and health development assistance. Looking at the internal reforms that China has carried out in the health area, which highlights as the most important? I approach, in the thesis, the reforms of the China Health System and I point out that the Chinese governance model is a unique combination of state -oriented economic reforms and development by the state, incorporating elements of neoliberalism and authoritarianism into political issues in general, and the health sector is nothing different from the rest. One of China's mentioned contributions, recognized by WHO, is its primary health care model based on the recognized good practice of “barefoot doctors” (barefoot doctors). In addition, the thesis analyzes the main reform policies and their progress and challenges in the period 2009-2018, which comprise the reforms of primary health care, hospital and pharmaceutical reform. The “Healthy China 2030” program is also an important and ambitious reference of China's domestic reforms in health, also encompassing social determinants. Is Beijing's intention to create an alternative entity to WHO, or simply create an alternative movement that can coexist with WHO, in the context of the relationship with the global south? How could this work? The thesis suggests that China adopts a "dual approach": while integrating in existing global structures, forging simultaneously alternative paths, particularly through regional alliances such as BRICS and partnerships with Global South. This indicates an intention to create an alternative movement that can coexist and complement the role of WHO, rather than a direct alternative entity. China demonstrates a clear commitment to align the objectives of the “Belt and Road” initiative with the united nations sustainable development objectives, showing their willingness to present these initiatives as complements to the existing cooperation mechanisms in the international liberal order. President Xi Jinping's view of a “future community shared for humanity”, which includes the notion of a “global health community for all”, also points to a new perspective in international cooperation. Traditional Chinese Masks, Vaccines and Medicine (MTC): What are China's products or instruments to position itself as an increasingly global actor in GGS? The thesis points out that China is an indispensable provider of global public health, essential for the product supply chain, such as masks and vaccines. The MTC is also mentioned as one of China's great contributions to global health governance, with its chinese herbal treatments, some of which already recognized by WHO in 2017. In addition, Chinese medical assistance and medical teams sent to other regions of the globe are important instruments of Chinese health diplomacy. In creating an alternative movement or reality to WHO, China may be taking advantage of the lack of full representativeness in the same WHO, or gaps in its operation? The thesis does not address directly whether China is taking advantage of a lack of full representativeness in WHO or gaps in its operation. However, it emphasizes that the work aims to fill a gap in scientific knowledge in relation to the paradigm of health governance from a non-western and liberal perspective, emphasizing China as an actor of the global south. This suggests that China seeks to strengthen alternative models that can offer more personalized health challenges, different from those defended by Western countries, positioning itself as a moderate reformist actor. How has the European Union (EU) foreign policy in relation to China affecting or influenced this position of the country in global health governance? In the thesis, the fourth publication, entitled "Challenges on the European Union-China Cooperation in Higher Education from" People-To-People Dialogue ’Perspective: The Case of Health-Related Joint Projects," explores cooperation in higher education, in particular that includes health-related projects. Therefore, despite the strategic and economic dialogue, the deterioration of UE-china bilateral relations intensified, with the commission to assume a decline of enthusiasm due to “China's countermeasures to EU human rights sanctions, economic coercion and commercial measures against the single market, and the positioning of China in the war in Ukraine”. Although challenges and tensions are recognized, cooperation in higher education, including health projects, is seen as part of a broader picture of strategic partnership between EU and China. However, it is evident that there is no long tradition of health cooperation between EU and China in higher education, and that there are few joint projects compared to the general panorama. It is suggested that both EU and China should make more efforts to align medical study curricula and promote more joint research in areas related to health, infectious diseases, among others. In the Trump 2.0 era, and without pandemic, what could be China's role in global health governance? Although the thesis is published this year, it focuses on the preceding period and includes the pandemic, where it does not speculate directly on a future scenario of “Trump 2.0” without pandemic. However, the thesis argues that China is not just a participant, but a moderate reformist force in the formation of global health standards. Regardless of future political scenarios, their growing economic and political influence, strategic health diplomacy, internal reforms and initiatives such as the Health Silk Route will continue to shape their role in global health governance. The view of a “global health community for all” also remains a guiding principle for China's efforts. Does this power of China in GGS verify more with bilateral or multilateral agreements? The thesis suggests that China's power in global health governance manifests itself through both bilateral and multilateral agreements, but with a growing emphasis on certain forms of cooperation that strengthen their role in the global south and through alternative mechanisms. Although the thesis does not explicitly quantify the predominance between bilateral and multilateral, the focus on regional alliances (BRICS) and partnerships with the Global South (which often involve bilateral agreements and group cooperation initiatives) and the Health Silk Route indicate a hybrid approach.

item.title: Macao Forum | Secretary-General says it has never discussed widening to Hispanic countries
item.description:
In an interview with Lusa agency, the secretary general of the Macau Forum, Ji Xianzheng, assured that “never discussed” the widening of action to Hispanic countries, but that to realize the will already stated by the government of Sam Hou Fai will have to be the authorities to decide a new direction to the cooperation strategy
The Secretary-General of the Macau Forum stated that the institution “never discussed” the creation of an entity to extend to Hispanic countries to promote economic cooperation similar to those who provide the connection between China and Portuguese-speaking countries. “Within the Macao Forum, we have never discussed this topic,” said the Forum Secretary-General for Economic and Commercial Cooperation between China and Portuguese-speaking countries Ji Xianzheng. The official acknowledged that, "in society, there were some conversations to discuss or address the possibility of promoting more contact and cooperation with Spanish -language countries, but at the Forum level we have never addressed this theme." The Macao executive announced in mid -April the intention of creating a center to promote economic services between China and the Portuguese and Spanish languages in the neighboring special Economic Zone of Hengqin. The idea is to provide companies in Hispanic countries services in the “linguistic, legal, fiscal, verification of compliance with norms, formation, arbitration and mediation”, according to the Secretary for Administration and Justice, André Cheong. Days earlier, the chief executive, Sam Hou Fai, had also announced the intention of “promoting exchange and cooperation” through Macao, between China and the universe of Spanish -speaking countries. Although Macau wants to widen focus to Castilian -speaking countries, “the forum will remain the forum for China and Lusophony countries,” said Ji Xianzheng. The secretary general clarified that the institution that directs "can contribute contributions to the greater opening of Macao in international cooperation", as is the intention announced by the new government of MSAR. Complementary forum Personally, the secretary-general guaranteed to have "all the pleasure of working with all parties," but stressed that this is a "decision that is up to the central governments to make" and that the forum was never contacted in this regard. "Yes, I worked in Latin America, Spain, nine years in Madrid and Caracas. But this is not a decision of personal interest, it is up to politicians to make the decision," he said, explaining that the idea will be to promote the relationship between Macao and Brazil and then to other Latin American countries, as well as expanding the relationship with Portugal to Spain. "There is no limit. The Macao Forum is complementary. It does not restrict any promotion of the cooperation of the other parts," he said. According to the Macao Government Communication Office, Sam Hou Fai admitted on June 21 that he postponed a trip to Portugal, scheduled for July, and should also pass through Spain and the European Union headquarters in Brussels. Bad interpretations In the same interview with Lusa, the Secretary-General of the Macao Forum imputed to national governments the responsibility for conducting development and economic cooperation policies, stressing that the institution “has no investment projects”. Ji Xianzheng attributes criticism to the Macao Forum to an wrong interpretation regarding the body's mission. "The forum is a mechanism of cooperation between central governments. Many people think it is to the secretariat that it is up to the execution of policies, but we have a limited number of people," added Ji. "The secretariat has no investment projects, is a mechanism for preparing the ministerial conference, connecting with governments, is not a promotion agency. It has not been thought of, connects with the promotion agencies. We are four people sent by China and one delegate for each country," he said. At the last ministerial conference, in April 2024, then Portuguese Economy Minister Pedro Reis argued that the Portuguese Language China-Parais Cooperation and Development Fund should bet more on small and medium enterprises (SMEs). The Cooperation Fund was created in 2013 by the China Development Bank and the Macao Industrial and Commercial Development Fund, with a thousand million dollars, of which about 60 percent have already been invested, according to the secretary general. Action plans Ji Xianzheng has admitted that SMEs are "a difficult theme for any government" and that "international cooperation for the promotion of development and cooperation of small and medium enterprises is even more difficult. It is a theme that is being debated in the world worldwide." But admitted, "here, little." "But it is stipulated in the action plan [2024-2026]. It is up to central governments and commerce chambers, promotion agents, to work together to do this. The secretariat assumes responsibility as authorized by the central governments, specifically, in the activities program," he said. Politicians from various countries, including Portugal, Angola and Mozambique, have appealed to a change in the rules of the fund's candidacy. Current rules require, for example, that candidate projects have a minimum investment of five million dollars, and the fund only covers 20 percent of total investment, referring the rest to governments or companies. Ji Xianzheng said the new direction of the fund "is committed to promoting a broader investment, with better coverage for all forum countries, [relatively] to projects that have a strategic or significant impact on the socioeconomic development of participating countries." According to the secretary general, "the terms of application [of the rules of access to the background] will be more flexible and the forms of application will also be more diverse." “Instead of being just direct investment, they are also studying ways to apply the fund, in cooperation with other funds or with other financial institutions,” he gave as an example. "This fund has an operation according to market rules. It is not a humanitarian aid fund. Therefore, it has to guarantee the minimum return of benefit. But, on that, they are very open to study, if by case the conditions of each project," added Ji Xianzheng, but to give examples of "flexibility of rules." Regarding the approximation of the China universe and countries of the Iberian Peninsula, already cemented in official speeches, economist Maria Fernanda Ilhéu, president of the Seda's New Route Association, told HM, earlier this month, that this intention is “very objective and pragmatic and can be summarized to the Macao economy diversification project, for which companies and investors are not only in Macao, but also from Macao, but also from countries, but also from countries, but also from countries, but also from countries Portuguese Language ”. "But the fact is that companies and institutions from Portuguese-speaking countries are not being effective in responding to this need for Macao. Therefore, widening companies and Spanish-speaking institutions this invitation to cooperation seems logical to me," the economist said.

item.title: Isabel Rio Novo, author of the biography of Luís de Camões: “Time in Macau was of tranquility”

It will be launched tomorrow, at the Consulate General of Portugal in Macau and Hong Kong, the biography of Luís de Camões, by Isabel Rio Novo. In an interview with HM, the author unravels some secrets about the poet's life in Macau, a period of relative calm in the middle of a almost always turbulent life
Why did you decide to get in the writing of another biography of Camões? It is true that Luis Vaz de Camões has been biographed many times over 500 years. However, 50 years ago there was no biography about him. From my point of view and the editor, Camões deserved a more current biography that revised all kinds of prejudices, seeking known sources, the uncovered information research and where the rereading of all previous works were rereading. This biography is not only a summary, but also the reinterpretation of what has been known, but which had rarely been related. The book also brings some new data with some documentation that was discovered. How was your relationship with the writing of Camões born? I fell in love and went to those young readers who was not tormented with Camões. On the contrary, I liked it soon and let myself be seduced by Camões Lyric. I am from the areas of comparative literature and history, and in this sense I always understood the dimension and importance of the work of Camões. And what are they? It is a work and an author of its time and its time, which was extraordinary, with the Renaissance, Humanism and the travels of navigation. But at the same time, it is a work that is the product of an outstanding literary genius, one that we can tell a handful in the history of universal literature. What camões we find in this biography? I tried to go to the bottom, remove layers of the meaning that these 500 years were adding to Camões, in the sense that each season read its Camões and produced its interpretation. I wanted to discover the substrate, the man of flesh and bone he lived and wrote 500 years ago. He was a man suffered, with many financial difficulties. He was a man with a complex and difficult relationship with reality, not only of his time, but also with reality [itself]. The theme of the time, the disconcerting of the world, how society seems to work instead of what should work, being a literary topic of the Renaissance, it was something Camões felt personal and genuinely. How? He lived a series of disagreements, of extreme experiences. Suffice it to say that you have been stuck several times and for various reasons. He made great trips at a time when these were absolutely risky, long, and complicated enterprises. Camões was involved in military expeditions, and almost all his life was soldered. But this set of experiences allowed him to be almost everything someone could be at the time he lived. He was one of the most traveled authors of the time, having been in Brazil, Goa… Yes. Even the connection to Macau, which is contested by some scholars, but not by me… I am persuaded, given the existing documentation and indirect testimonies, which Camões passed through China with the position of Dead and Missing Provider. When this happened, albeit very incipiently, the Portuguese establishment in China, which was already Macao. It is not known whether Camões held this position assigned to him by Viceroy D. Francisco Coutinho, if he was exactly assigned to be a provider during the trip, or a provider at Macao's establishment. But what he knew from China was surely this little warehouse that Portugal had achieved, at a lot of cost, with great difficulty and after many attempts to obtain in China. What did a deceased provider? Whenever a Portuguese died in the East, a soldier or merchant, it was necessary to ensure the rights of the heirs, the families who were normally in Portugal. The provider had to identify the deceased, his naturalness, origin and make the heirs known. He also had to keep the deceased's assets before they were stolen, auction them, keep the coins that would result in, and then take it all to Lisbon. It was a process that, if it went well, took many months, because it was necessary to send this money to the authorities of Goa who later sent him in the career from India to Lisbon. Can we talk about a period of stability in Camões's life in Macau? Yes. Until this appointment as a deceased provider, everything Camões knew from the East had been as a soldier. As soon as Goa [1553] arrives weeks later in a first military expedition. We know why: Not because I had some war appeal, but because only participating in expeditions earned your welding. Although everyone said that the soldiers lived very poorly, the welding was what Camões had to survive. The time lived in Macao, when he was free from soldier obligations, was a time of tranquility regarding subsistence, which was assured. He had some time and calm to continue the work with "the Lusíadas." More than that, as much as the sources allow to deduce, Camões met in Macau a phase of balance in terms of personal and loving life, as, on the return trip, he brought with him, according to the testimony of Diogo do Couto, a Chinese girl. Dinamene. This was the term used by the chronicler. We don't know if it would be a Chinese or Asian girl. This girl with whom Camões lived maritally was someone who liked it very much, according to the testimony of Diogo do Couto. But Dinamene would certainly not be her name, as it was a mythological name that, by the way, Camões used in her lyric, even before she boarded the East. Chinese girls with whom soldiers and merchants in Macao lived amanced were baptized and received a Christian name. Therefore, Dinamene would even have a Christian and Portuguese name. But as we do not know her name, and if we are aware that we use a kind of metaphor, we can call it Dinamene. She dies later on a trip and makes Camões very shaken. On Macao's return trip to Goa, probably at the end of his mandate as a provider, Camões suffers the celebrated wreck, in which he loses the personal assets he had ease, including the assets of the deceased that he was guardian, and this will bring him complications. It also suffers the loss of dynamine. The wreck went with some in the seas of China, probably by the mouth of the Mekong River. Considers unlikely to have lost part of "the Lusíadas." The first biographers say Camões was saved from this wreck with a board. It is not unreasonable that he managed to save the manuscript of the Lusíadas on this board. But it is also no excluding that Camões knew his poem by heart. The memory of people in the sixteenth century was different. They were very used to keeping things from memory. And we know, because the proof is obtained in the work of Camões, that it had an extraordinary memory. I have a way to prove it, of course, that Camões is one of the rare authors who knew his poem by heart. Do you think Camões had a lower life to his true talent? Undoubtedly. According to a too extensive set of concordant testimonies, he dies poor, even in miserable conditions, and according to an eyewitness, without having a blanket with which he covered himself. On the other hand, Camões was known to follow the publication of the Lusíadas, who were commented and read [in the poet's life time]. We have the testimony of Faria de Sousa, one of the first biographers of Camões, which says that when he passed the streets, people stop and pointed. Camões also had a figure that stood out, with a leaked eye and using a pale. By then, I would be quite sick, using crutches. But there is a set of poets, which is very unreliable that they did not know Camões, who never refer to them. There are, on the other hand, other humanists, such as Pedro Magalhães Gândavo, who from the outset praises him as the prince of Portuguese poets. But the king gives him a tendency for deeds provided and the publication of "The Lusíadas." This famous tendency, which should not be a big deal, because all ancient biographers say it was derisive, is attributed to him as a kind of military reform, because of the 17 years of service in the East, and not as a reward for the publication of "The Lusíadas." D. Sebastião's mercy letter, which attributes him the title of nobleman knight, had no repercussion in practice, but gave him 15 thousand reais. [The publication of “the Lusíadas”] was an additional argument [for the letter] and not the main argument. This leads us to believe that D. Sebastião will not even have read or heard “the Lusíadas”, will have received indirect information, favorable about the poem. How did the process of editing “Os Lusíadas” occurred? It was an event, because both the press and the books that were published a year were a very small amount. In the year in which “the Lusíadas” are published were the only work of non -religious caress [to be edited]. To fund the edition, it is more than likely that Camões had the support of a patron, probably D. Manuel de Portugal, from the Condes do Vimioso family. Getting the work was a press was a mere and complicated process, as it had to go through the prior examination of the civil authorities, the royal authority and the censorship of the Inquisition. The resident of the Holy Office does not only let the book pass, but to make an amount of almost unprecedented compliments in the license that authorizes the publication of the work. If we go to the opinions emitted by the same rear, there is no other work on which he is as compliments as it was with the epic of Camões. In Indonesia, he befriended a slave to the island of Java. Camões was, at least once, on the island of Ternate, Indonesia, in the archipelago of molucas, at a time when there were conflicts motivated by an extremely cruel Portuguese captain towards the king or sultan of Ternate, which originated a kind of war between the Portuguese and the places. Camões has a song that describes the island of Ternate. We do not know if it was at this time, or in another passage to the Far East, that Camões turned on to a Jaú, or Javanese, but could not be exactly from the Far East, but a freed slave who had been linked by friendship to Camões. And this is because in one of the first biographies of Camões it reads that Jaú, with the Christian name António, asked for alms at night. This freedom of movements of a slave indicates that he would probably be a freed slave.
